title: Event Programming Lead, Gaming & Immersive Worlds @ Consensus Festival (Contractor)
content:
CoinDesk is the most trusted media, events, indices and data company for the global crypto economy.  Since 2013, CoinDesk Media has led the story of the future of money and investing, illuminating the transformation in society and culture that comes with it. Our award-winning team of journalists delivers news and unparalleled insights that bring transparency, comprehension and context. CoinDesk Events gathers the global crypto, blockchain and Web3 communities at annual events such as Consensus, the world's largest and longest-running crypto festival. CoinDesk Indices offers expertise in digital asset indices, data and research to educate and empower investors. For more information on CoinDesk media and events, please visit coindesk.com and for breaking headlines, data and indices visit coindeskmarkets.com.About Consensus
Curated and produced by CoinDesk, Consensus is the most influential crypto & blockchain experience of the year. Held since 2015, Consensus is the only festival showcasing and celebrating all sides of the blockchain, crypto, and Web 3 ecosystems, and their wide-reaching effect on commerce, culture, and communities.
This year, Consensus will be held in Austin, Texas from May 29-31, 2024, and will bring tens of thousands of attendees together to hear from sought-after thought leaders and experience a wide range of discussions, meetings, parties, music performances, dinners, experiences, and much more.
We are seeking a dynamic subject-matter expert to help curate the Web3 Gaming, Virtual Economy, and Immersive World stage sessions at Consensus 2024. They will co-lead and lead the content programming and speaker selection for Gaming & Immersive Worlds sessions, with an emphasis on exploring the intersection of blockchain and Gaming. 
Gaming & Immersive Worlds Summit Description: Join industry experts, designers, and innovative builders as they converge to explore the cutting-edge technologies and trends that fuel the rapidly evolving sector of game-powered digital environments, digital identity, and the utility of on-chain assets. This summit will take you on a deep dive into the realm of blockchain-based gaming, augmented and fully immersive sensorial experiences while discussing the future of human-computer interaction
About the Role
Note: This is a part-time contract position with estimated project end date of June 14, 2024. We are open to candidates located in New York, Austin, or other remote locations in US Eastern Standard, Central, or Pacific Standard Time Zones.
The Gaming & Immersive Worlds Events Programming Lead will help steer and nurture Consensus’s vital relationships with various key Gaming and Metaverse stakeholders, companies, and those moving the needle or about to.  involve guiding the programming about and by these different constituencies, on various stages and events within Consensus, where speakers will showcase, discuss, and debate different innovations, strategies, and predictions. There is also an opportunity to form an advisory committee that helps bring fresh ideas to Consensus and ensures it is covering the leading tech developments. 
The Gaming & Immersive Worlds Events Programming Lead will work closely with the rest of the Consensus event operations and programming teams to help set the wider Consensus agenda, with an emphasis on bringing the best Gaming executives, artists, academics, and thought leaders to the Event, the Main Stage and elsewhere in the program. They will attend regular programming meetings, where they will discuss and suggest speakers, topics, and formats for all sessions. As with their colleagues, they will be expected to conduct speaker outreach to secure talent for the agenda. 
The role reports to the Executive Editor for Events Programming but will continue to take guidance and assignments from the Chief Content Officer and the Managing Director of Consensus. 
Responsibilities

Guide the overall development of the Gaming vertical for CoinDesk and Consensus
Develop target lists of speakers, topics, pairings, companies & media within the relevant verticals 
Reach out to potential speakers and companies, and lead discussions to secure their commitment to speak at Consensus.
Attend weekly Programming meetings to provide updates and receive feedback on ideas
Be well-versed and connected with the Gaming space
Create session titles and descriptions, liaise with speakers on session timing and support materials, help identify moderators to lead conversations

About You

You have 2+ years of experience in content creation or event programming
You are highly collaborative, communicate effectively, tech-savvy, and possess superb organizational skills
Capable of building strong relationships and leveraging your subject matter expertise within the category
Proven success in owning and managing projects
Strong writing skills and attention to detail 
Ability to multitask and creatively problem-solve under deadlines and in a live-event environment
Previous work experience or a strong interest in cryptocurrencies, web3, and blockchain technologies is a plus 
Comfortable with multiple technology and data management systems: event platforms, Airtable, Excel,  Google Drive, etc 
Comfortable working in and excited by the challenges of a fast-paced, start-up culture
EQUAL OPPORTUNITY
In an effort to attract, retain, develop and promote the most qualified individuals, CoinDesk is committed to treating all applicants and employees in a nondiscriminatory manner with respect to the terms and conditions of employment, without regard to race, color, religion or belief, sex, national or ethnic origin, ancestry, age, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, veteran status/service, physical or mental disability, or any other classification protected by applicable law. This mandate governs all aspects of employment, including recruitment, selection, promotion, training, education, social and recreation programs, compensation, discipline, termination and access to benefits.
For more information on our DEI initiatives, please visit: https://www.coindesk.com/dei/.
ACCOMMODATION
CoinDesk is also committed to providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities. If you need a reasonable accommodation because of a disability for any part of the application process, please send an e-mail to accomodations@coindesk.com and let us know the nature of your request.
 
Please note that only a member of CoinDesk’s Talent Acquisition team will reach out to you directly from an @coindesk.com or @coindesk-indices.com email in regards to any and all opportunities at CoinDesk. Disregard emails from any other addresses or persons. If you’re selected to move onto the next phase of our hiring process, a member of our team will reach out to guide you through our interview process. We look forward to connecting!
